lines.text: Are these pictures live?
Unlike the American government, we prefer not to get our bad news from CNN.
You don't like me, Bond. You don't like my methods. You think I'm an accountant, a bean counter more interested in my numbers than your instincts.
The thought had occurred to me.
Good, because I think you're a sexist, misogynist dinosaur. A relic of the Cold War, whose boyish charms, though wasted on me, obviously appealed to that young woman I sent out to evaluate you.
Point taken.

We're both orphans, James. But while your parents had the luxury of dying in a climbing accident, mine survived the British betrayal and Stalin's execution squads. My father couldn't let himself or my mother live with the shame. MI6 figured I was too young to remember. And in one of life's little ironies, the son went to work for the government whose betrayal caused the father to kill himself and his wife.
Hence Janus. The two-faced Roman god come to life.
It wasn't God who gave me this face! It was you, setting the timers for three minutes instead of six.
Am I supposed to feel sorry for you?
No. You were supposed to die for me.
[pause]
And, by the way, I did think about asking you to join my little scheme but somehow I knew, 007's loyalty was always to the mission, never to his friend.
[louder]
Closing time, James! Last call.
[Bond raises his gun to kill Alec but is tranquilized by a sniper]

[walks towards Bond and looks down on him]
For England, James.
Jack Wade, CIA.
James Bond, stiff-ass Brit.
[Q has blown up a dummy with an explosive pen]
Don't say it...
The writing is on the wall.
Along with the rest of him.
[Bond and Natalya are trying to escape from the train when Trevelyan talks to them on the loudspeaker]
Good luck with the floor James. I've set the timers for six minutes, the same six minutes you gave me. It was the least I could do for a "friend".
[snickers]
What does he mean?
We've got three minutes.
[repeated line]
I am invincible!
Good morning, Mr. Bond. Sit. I'm Defense Minister Dimitri Mishkin. So, by what means shall we execute you, Commander Bond?
What, no small-talk? No chit-chat? That's the trouble with the world today. No one takes the time to do a really sinister interrogation anymore. It's a lost art.
Your sense of humour does not sway me, Commander, I'm sorry. Where is the GoldenEye?
I assumed you had it.
I have an English spy, a Severnaya programmer and a helicopter stolen...
...or at least that's what some traitor in your government wanted it to look like.
Who was behind your attack on Severnaya?
WHO HAD THE AUTHORIZATION CODES?
RUSSIA MAY HAVE CHANGED BUT THE PENALTY FOR TERRORISM IS STILL DEATH!
AND WHAT'S THE PENALTY FOR TREASON?
Oh, stop it, both of you! Stop it! You're like boys with toys!
[Bond picks up a sandwich roll, studying it like a gadget]
Don't touch that! It's my lunch!
Governments change... the lies stay the same.
Seems your hunch was right, 007. It's too bad the Evil Queen of Numbers wouldn't let you play it...
[M walks in]
You were saying?
No, no, I was just... just um...
Good. Because if I want sarcasm, Mr Tanner, I'll talk to my children, thank you very much.
Who is the competition?
Ah, an ex-KGB guy. Tough mother. Got a limp in his right leg. Name's Zukovsky.
Valentin Dmitrovitch Zukovsky?
Yeah, you know him?
I gave him the limp.
In 16 minutes and 43 sec - in 42 seconds, the United Kingdom will reenter the stone age.
A worldwide financial meltdown. And all so mad little Alec can settle a score with the world, 50 years on.

Oh, please James, spare me the Freud. I might as well ask you for the vodka martinis that have silenced the screams of all the men you've killed... or if you find forgiveness in the arms of all those willing women, for all the dead ones you failed to protect.
He wouldn't know a woman if one came up and sat on his head.
A pen. This is a Class 4 grenade. Three clicks arms the four-second fuse, another three disarms it.
[Bond takes the pen, clicks three times]
How long did you say the fuse was?
[Q takes the pen back and disarms it]
Oh grow up, 007.
They always said the pen was mightier than the sword.
Thanks to me they were right!

[while talking about the incident at Savernaya]
They're not just criminals Valentin, they're traitors.
Well, what do you expect from a Lienz Cossack?
What?
This Janus, I've never met the man, but I know that he is a Lienz Cossack.
Group that worked for the Nazis against the Russians. Second World War.

You know your history, Mr. Bond. At the end of the war, they surrendered to the British, thinking they would help in waging war against the Communists. But, the British betrayed them, sent them back to Stalin, who promptly had them all shot. Women, children, entire families.
Not exactly our finest hour.
Still, ruthless people. They got what they deserved.
You don't need the gun, Commander.
Well, that depends on your definition of safe sex.

[grabs a machine gun that's on the ground but Bond puts his foot on it first]
Why can't you just be a good boy and die?
You first.
[looks at Xenia]
You, second. UP!
Do you destroy every vehicle you get into?
Standard operating procedure. Boys with toys.
James, is it really necessary to drive quite so fast?
More often than you'd think.
This is Colonel Ourumov. Come out with your hands above your head.
How original.
He wants *me* to do him a favor! My knee aches every single day! Twice as bad when it is cold. Do you have any idea how long the winter lasts in this country? Tell him, Dmitri.
Well, it depends...
SILENCE!

[hanging from his foot held by Bond's hands]
For England, James?
No. For me.
[lets Trevelyan go]
[Q appears, wheelchair-bound with his leg in a cast]
Morning Q. Sorry about the leg. Skiing?
[Q's leg "cast" fires a rocket across the room]
Hunting!
three, anyway.
motoring and, uh, baccarat.
[James reveals a losing hand]
I hope the third is where your real talent lies.
One rises to meet a challenge.
I trusted you, Alec.
Trust? What a quaint idea.
Vodka martini - shaken, not stirred. And for you?
The same.
How do you take it?
Straight up - with a twist.

[Talking about Natalya]
Did you check her out?
Head to toe.

Right. Now pay attention 007. First, your new car. BMW Agile 54 with gears. All points radar. Self destruct system. And, naturally, all the usual refinements. Now, this I'm particularly proud of - behind the headlights, stinger missiles!
Excellent, just the thing for unwinding after a rough day at the office.
Need I remind you, 007, that you have a licence to kill, not to break the traffic laws.
He was a friend, Trevelyan?
Yes.
Now he's your enemy and you will kill him. It is that simple?
In a word, yes.
Unless he kills you first?
Natalya...
You think I'm impressed? All of you with your guns, your killing, your death. For what? So you can be a hero? All the heroes I know are dead. How can you act like this? How can you be so cold?
It's what keeps me alive.
No. It's what keeps you alone.
James... what an unpleasant surprise.
We aim to please.
the girl or the mission?
It's too easy.
Half of everything is luck, James.
And the other half?
[alarms begin to go off]
Fate!
Thank you, Mister...
The name's Bond. James Bond.
Xenia Sergeyevna Onatopp.
Onatopp?
Onatopp.
Alec?
Back from the dead. No longer just an anonymous star on the memorial wall at MI6. What's the matter, James? No glib remark? No pithy comeback?
See you in hell, James.
I know what you're doing.
Really? What's that, dear?
You are just trying to show off the size of your... your um...
Engine?
Ego.

[as Bond draws a gun to his head]
Walther PPK, 7.65 millimeter. Only three men I know use such a gun. I believe I've killed two of them.
Lucky me.
[a gun is pointed at the back of Bond's head]
I think not.
She always did enjoy a good squeeze.
[first lines]
[Russian in toilet cubicle looks around his newspaper to see Bond hanging from the ceiling]
Beg your pardon, forgot to knock.

[arms the Goldeneye to fire at London]
God save the Queen.
I enjoy a spirited ride as much as the next girl, but...
[a woman, Xenia Onatopp, pulls up alongside and smiles]
Who's that?
The next girl.

[whistles]
Shh. I have a small surprise from your friends back at the barracks.
I think I've gone to heaven.
Not yet.
[She shoots him]
Why?
"Well done, good job, but sorry, old boy, everything you risked your life and limb for has changed."
It was the job we were chosen for.
Of course you'd say that, James Bond, her majesty's loyal terrier, defender of the so-called faith.
This time, Mr. Bond, the pleasure will be all mine.
M authorizes you to observe Miss Onatopp but stipulates no - contact without prior approval. End transmission, Moneypenny. Good night, James. I trust you'll stay - Onatopp of things.
So why did you not kill me?
Call it professional courtesy.

[Drawing a gun]
Then I should extend you the same courtesy.
A typical leather belt, size...
Q, I'm familiar with that device.
On the train, when you told him to kill me, and that I meant nothing to you, did you mean it?
always call their bluff.

[to Bond]
If you think for one moment I don't have the balls to send a man out to die, your instincts are dead wrong. I have no compunction about sending you to your death. But, I won't do it on a whim. Even with your cavalier attitude towards life.
Come on, my car's over there.
After you.
Thank you.
[comes up after Jack Wade and traps him with the car door and draws his gun on him]
Like you said, "Drop it".
All right, in London April is a spring month, whereas in St. Petersburg we're freezing our butts off. Is that close enough for government work?
No. Show me the rose.
Please, no.
[Bonds shoves his gun into Wade]
Alright, alright, alright.
[Wade unbuckles his pants and shows him his rose tattoo with the name "Muffy"]
Muffy?
Third wife.

[as soldiers blow up a door]
Shut the door Alec! There's a draft!
You know, this sort of behaviour could qualify as sexual harassment.
Really. What's the penalty for that?
Someday, you'll have to make good on your innuendos.
James Bond. Charming, sophisticated secret agent. "Shaken, but not disturbed."
[Zukovsky and his men laugh]
I see you haven't lost your delicate sense of humour, Valentin.
[nods toward the stage]
Or your need for an audience. Who's strangling the cat?

[looks towards the stage]
Strangling a cat?
[Zukovsky looks over at Irina, who singing out of tune, then takes out his gun and shoots right between Bond's legs]
That is Irina, my mistress.
Very talented girl. Tell her to go.
[Zukovsky looks to the stage]
Irina, take a hike!
Hmm, never seen you after hours, Moneypenny... lovely.
Thank you, James.
Out on some kind of fashion assignment, dressing to kill?

I know you'll find this crushing, 007, but I don't sit at home every night praying for some international incident so I can run down here all dressed up to impress James Bond. I was on a date, if you must know, with a gentlemen. We went to the theater together.
Moneypenny, I'm devastated.
What is it with you and moving vehicles?
James, I want you to stop this car!
Really?
Stop this car at once!
[Bond yanks the handbrake up and the car skids to a complete stop and moves in close to Caoline]
As you can see, I have no problem with female authority.
[Opens a box of Bollinger Grand Annee Champagne 1988]
James, you're incorrigible. What am I going to do with you?
Well, let's toast to your evaluation, shall we?
[Kiss]
A very - thorough - evaluation.
Who are you?
I work for the British government. The more you tell me the more I can help you.
Now, let me get this straight Jimmy - you shot him in the leg, you stole his car, you took his girl. And now you want Valentin Zukovsky to set you up with Janus?
Yes
Well what are you going to do, appeal to his heart?
No, his wallet.
Oh, that might work.
[Farrell struggles to breathe while he has sex with Xenia]
Xenia, I can't breathe!
[gasps for air]

[after leading her to Janus at gunpoint]
Well, I've had a lovely evening, you?
Once again, Mr. Bond, the pleasure was all yours.
You'll understand if I don't call.
I won't lose sleep over it.

[Karate-chops her neck, knocking her unconscious]
Sweet dreams.

[Bond throws Onatopp off himself]
No, no, no. No more foreplay. Take me to Janus.
BULIATCH!

[Kissing in a field]
I suppose there's someone watching.
There's no-one within twenty-five miles, believe me.

[Out of nowhere]
Yo, Jimbo!
Enjoy it while it lasts.
The very words I live by.
Well, I must say, I've had a lovely evening. You?
Once again the pleasure was all yours.
[Natalya is trying to find Boris' location while Bond cuts a hole in the floor of the train]

[referring to Boris' password]
What else do you call your bottom?
What?
It's Boris' password, he plays word games. It's what I sit on but I don't take it with me.
Chair.
Like I said.
[Starts tracing Boris' location]

[breaking a hole in the train with his foot]
Thirty seconds!
He's not in Russia, Germany, Paris, London, Madrid.
Twenty-five seconds!
New York, Toronto, Chicago, San Francisco.
Twenty seconds!
Mexico City, Rio, Miami.
[Bond breaks a hole in the floor of the train and grabs Natalya by the arm]
Come on!
Wait, he's in Cuba. Havana...
[the trace is terminated]
Now!
[Bond and Natalya escape from the train with seconds to spare before the train explodes]
[Ourumov's car has just entered a crowded marketplace]
Use the bumper! That's what it's for!
In London, April's a spring month.

Oh yeah? And what are you, the weatherman? I mean, for crying out loud... another stiff-ass Brit, with your secret codes and your passwords. One of these days you guys are gonna learn just to drop it.
[Ourumov storms into the interrogation room where Bond and Natalya are being held]
Defence minister, I must protest! This is my investigation! You're out of order!
[Mishkin speaks to Ourumov in Russian]
From what I'm hearing it is you who is out of order!

[picking up Bond's PPK]
I've seen this gun before...
Put it down!
In the hand of our enemy!
Put it down, General!
Do you know even who the enemy is, Dimitri? DO YOU?

[getting up from his chair]
GUARD!
[firing Bond's PPK, Ourumov shoots the guard and Mishkin. Bond and Natalya fall to the floor]
Defence Minister Dimitri Mishkin murdered by British agent James Bond...
[Ourumov throws Bond his empty PPK and takes out his own pistol]
...himself shot while he was trying to escape. GUARDS!

[to Natalia]
Take a seat, my dear. You know, James and I shared everything. Absolutely everything... to the victor go the spoils.
Bond is alive?
He escaped.
Good for Bond. Bad for you.
You're late, 007.
I had to stop in the bathroom.
Ready to save the world again?
After you, 006.
James, for England.
For England, Alec.
So Mr. Bond, what is it that brings you to my neighborhood? Still working for MI6, or have you decided to join the 21st century? I hear the new M is a lady!
Now, a typical leather belt... male, size 34 buckle, notch.
[Bond is playing with a computer]
Are you finished?
[Bond closes the laptop]
Yes.
Good. A typical leather belt...
You know, James... I was always better.
[Trevelyan and Ourumov are holding Natalya hostage on the train]
Ourumov, what has this Cossack promised you? You knew, didn't you? He's a Lienz Cossack.
It's in the past.
He'll betray you! Just like everyone else.
Is this true?
What's true is that in 48 hours you and I will have more money than God. And Mr. Bond here will have a small memorial service with only Moneypenny and a few tearful restaurateurs in attendance.
[last lines]
Maybe you two would like to finish debriefing each other at Guantanamo, hmm?
You ready?
I'm not going on a helicopter with you. No plane. No train. Nothing that moves.
Darling, what could possibly go wrong, eh?
[after 006 kisses Natalya]
Lovely girl. Tastes like... like strawberries.
I wouldn't know.
I would.
Are you sure you want to do this? The last guy who dropped in uninvited went home air freight, in very small boxes.
Make sure they send me home first class.
This is not one of your games, Boris. Real people will die, you pathetic little worm!
She was in the mainframe. Check the computer.
She's a moron. A second level programmer.
[mockingly]
She works on the guidance system. She doesn't even have access to the filing codes.
[Alarm starts buzzing]

[shaking a malfunctioning computer monitor vigorously]
Speak to me!
I'm alone.
Aren't we all?
Do something, get us out of here!
I'm a little tied up! Never mind...
It's clean. I had to ventilate someone.
What would I ever do without you?
As far as I can remember, James, you've never had me.
Hope springs eternal.
The things we do for frequent flyer mileage.
Bond. Only Bond.
So, tell me. Are there any other standard operating procedures I should be aware of?
A thousand. But I only pay them...
[Natalia and James kiss]
...lip service.
Kill him. The man just won't take a hint.
[Bond draws his gun]
Oh, please, James, put it away. It's insulting to think I haven't anticipated your every move.
Governments change. The lies stay the same.
You break into the Bank of England via computer, and transfer the money electronically. Just minutes before you set off the GoldenEye, which erases any trace of the transactions. Ingenious.
Thank you, James.
But still, it boils down to petty theft. In the end, you're just a bank robber. Nothing more than a common thief.
Natalya! Shh, shh, it's me! It's Boris. It's Boris. It's Boris. Hello.
Closing time, James. Last call!
Buy me a pint.
What words do you live by?
The trick is to quit while you're still ahead.
That's one trick I've never learned. Perhaps you'll show me how it's done.
Your accent, Georgian?
Very good, Mr. Bond. You've been to Russia?
Not recently. I used to drop in occasionally. Shoot in and out.
Boris!
What? I thought I'd post it on the internet, no?
What's the password?
I made it easy this time. Even you should be able to break it - borscht for brains. Alright. Alright. I'll give you a hint. They're right in front of you and can open very large doors.

Knockers]
You're such a geek.
The Americans are slugheads! They'll never detect me.
Unauthorized Access Detected]
You were saying, slughead.
Nobody screws with Boris Grishenko!
Was it good for you too?
I'm getting some coffee.
I'm going for a cigarette.
General, if I'd known...
You'd have been ready. This is an unscheduled test of the Severnaya facility, Major. War simulation. You're going to test fire GoldenEye. Report the status.
After you, Moneypenny.
No, I insist. You first.
So - GoldenEye exist.
Yes.
What else do we know about the Janus syndicate?

Top flight arms dealers headquartered in St. Petersburg. First outfit to restock the Iraqis during the Gulf War. The head man's unreliably described. No photographs. The woman - Onatopp - is our only confirmed contact.
Would you care for a drink?
Thank you. Your predecessor kept some cognac on the top...
I prefer bourbon. Ice?
Yes.
I want you to find GoldenEye. Find who took it, what they plan to do with it, and stop it.
Bond - come back alive.
Will you hand me that wrench, Jimmy?
So, what do you know about Janus?
Zilch!

Rumor has it, he lives on one of those old Soviet missile trains. That armored stuff they used to run around the country so we couldn't target 'em. You want to hand me that hammer, Jimbo. No, the bigger one. The sledge. Anyways, to tell the truth, you don't find this guy, he finds you.
Trust me.
Trust you? I don't even know your name.

[From his private train, sees a tank blocking the railroad tracks ahead]
Bond. Only Bond.

[excitedly]
He's going to derail us.
Full speed! Full speed!
hopeless. You have no backup. No escape route. And I - have the only bargaining chip.
Where is she?
Ah, yes. Your fatal weakness.
[On a Walkie Talkie]
Ourumov, bring her in.
Don't stand there, get us out of here!
Yes sir.
Maybe I should take care of the transportation for our trip to Cuba.
Our trip?
Do you know how to disarm the weapon?
I suppose that depends on what kind of weapon you're talking about disarming.
Hello, Jimbo! Well, a little gift from ole, eh, what's his name? T? Z?
Q.

[after hacking into an FBI database and blocking their trace scan]
Better luck next time... Slugheads!
[Jack Wade borrows Bond's BMW]
Don't push any of the buttons in that car.
I'm just gonna go bombing around in it.
Exactly.
[Xenia Onatopp approaches James Bond]
That's close enough.
Not for what I have in mind.
I like a woman who enjoys pulling rank.
Nice to meet you - Mr. Bond.
The pleasure, I'm sure, was all mine.
Say Bond, do you do any gardening?
